titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Berton W. Crandall Proof Album collection
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Berton W Crandall proof album collection
did.abstract: Proof albums assembled by Crandall of photograph taken during the year to be browsed by patrons of his Palo Alto studio. Crandall concentrated primarily on Stanford athletics and student activities. Sports most heavily documented are football, track, and baseball; others include crew, swimming, basketball, gymnastics, and polo. There are a few photographs of women's crew, track, and basketball teams. Student activities include the Frosh-Soph Tie-Up, student parades, initiations of the honor society Skull & Snakes and the Press Club, dances, plays, Plug Ugly events, junior day activities on Lake Lagunita, and commencement processions. Special events documented include John C. Branner's inauguration as Stanford University President, 1913; and the Student Army Training Corps, 1916-1917.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Berton W. Crandall Proof Album Collection (PC0003). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Berton W. Crandall moved with his family to Palo Alto in 1898 from Pompey, New York, where he had been born in 1882. After graduating from Palo Alto High School, he attended Stanford University, earning his bachelor’s degree in chemistry in January 1907. A professional photographer, he also owned and operated a photography store on University Avenue in Palo Alto. He died in May of 1979.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Proof albums assembled by Crandall of photograph taken during the year to be browsed by patrons of his Palo Alto studio. Crandall concentrated primarily on Stanford athletics and student activities. Sports most heavily documented are football, track, and baseball; others include crew, swimming, basketball, gymnastics, and polo. There are a few photographs of women's crew, track, and basketball teams. Student activities include the Frosh-Soph Tie-Up, student parades, initiations of the honor society Skull & Snakes and the Press Club, dances, plays, Plug Ugly events, junior day activities on Lake Lagunita, and commencement processions. Special events documented include John C. Branner's inauguration as Stanford University President, 1913; and the Student Army Training Corps, 1916-1917.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: photographs arranged by negative number within each album.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Student Army Training Corps.

scopecontent.p: Crowd scene in Palo Alto during T. Roosevelt's visit
This volume is of individual athletes, yell leaders, and coaches; it also includes a photograph of Sam McDonald.
Branner's Inauguration as University President; Encina Hall's Annual Evening Dress Affair; bonfire; Lake Lagunita events; Skull & Snakes; graduation procession in Quad; a few women's events

Junior Day procession to the Mausoleum and other events; European Market in Palo Alto; Press Club initiation; bonfire; Lincoln Beachy flying plane around Berkeley Campanile; Skull & Snakes; graduation procession
European Market in Palo Alto; bonfire; student costume parade
Encina Hall residents on steps; Study Army Training Corps in Inner Quad, training in the hills, and marching in Palo Alto; Roughs Day
Dr. Stillman at train station; Major Pourie; Camp Fremont – barber, tents; Palo Alto Armory YCMA; Coach Wylie
[This volume is boxed with 1917-1918.] Swimmer Norman Ross; Airplane on campus (part of a sorority aviation party); Stanford ROTC; Armistice Parade in Palo Alto; Coach Evans
Women's basketball game and track meet; polo and horsemanship contest; students working at Convalescent Home
Sports are basketball, baseball, track & field, and tennis.
Sports are basketball, track & field, football, swimming, polo, and baseball.
